TopicTitle: Hi All, My name is Gent Harris

Articles.Content:
I just discovered this game after reading a news story where Elon Musk endorsed it, hey I gotta check this out!!!

I was born in 1957 and have always been in love with the space program but never had the opportunity to participate.

I just started Friday and I love it so far!!!

One question and I think I know the answer, in the tutorials I'm able to collect surface samples but starting from scratch in career mode

it seems that I can't?

And when I try to EVA in space it says I need to upgrade my astronaut facility??

This is making it tough to gather much science, but I have been able to do some contracts and get some funds??

Any tips would be welcome!!

Glad to be on board this looks like an awesome forum!!

Welcome to the forums! I haven't played career mode much (I mainly test out ideas in sandbox) but I think I can answer your questions.

Surface samples and EVA capabilities require a building upgrade (which can be done by right clicking a building, there should be an upgrade button). Offhand I think that because they involve kerbals on EVA, they might require astronaut facility upgrades.

Building upgrades cost a lot of money, though, so you may have to do a lot of contracts (especially in hard mode) before you have enough.

You'll also find that other things (there are limits on how heavy you can build a rocket on the launch pad, certain tracking capabilities, like maneuver nodes, which are very helpful) also require building upgrades.

The in-game tutorials don't cover too much, so as further reading I recommend the official wiki, very helpful if you're wondering about specifics of say, a specific planet, or part. (They also have tutorials, which are very helpful for early goals, such as getting to orbit, landing on the Mun (moon), etc.) http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Main_Page

or if you prefer videos, Scott Manley has excellent informational/good videos: https://www.youtube.com/user/szyzyg including tutorials for more advanced topics, like docking, landing on other planets, etc.

And if you can't find any tutorials to help you in a specific case, or just need help, the gameplay questions forum is always happy to help. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/15-Gameplay-Questions-and-Tutorials

I hope you have fun playing Kerbal Space Program! (And remember that the game is very much still in progress, so there will be bugs and balance issues, but hopefully they should be far and few between.)

Yes, update 0.90.0 now requires you to research EVA suits by upgrading your Astronaut Complex. So, stuff like satellite deployment contracts are the name of the game until you've got the EVA capabilities, whereupon you can get EVA reports and surface samples.

(Yes, the Elon Musk thing has been spreading like booster fuel, hasn't it? )
